MediaStream.summary: The MediaStream interface of the {{domxref("Media Capture and Streams API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents a stream of media content. A stream consists of several tracks, such as video or audio tracks. Each track is specified as an instance of .

remarks.para: You can obtain a MediaStream object either by using the constructor or by calling functions such as , , or and .

-Using the MediaStream Recording API
-WebRTC API
-Web Audio API
-

MediaStreamGetVideoTracks.summary:
The getVideoTracks() method of the
interface returns a sequence of
objects representing the video tracks in this stream.
MediaStreamGetVideoTracks.returns:
An array of objects, one for each video track contained
in the media stream. Video tracks are those tracks whose
property is video. The array
is empty if the stream contains no video tracks.
NOTEThe order of the tracks is not defined by the specification,
and may not be the same from one call to getVideoTracks() to another.

MediaStreamGetTracks.summary:
The getTracks() method of the
interface returns a sequence that represents all the
objects in this
stream's track set,
regardless of .

MediaStreamAddTrack.summary:
The addTrack() method of the interface adds a new track to the
stream. The track is specified as a parameter of type .

blockquote.para:
If the specified track is already in the stream's track set, this method has no
effect.

MediaStreamMediaStream.summary: The MediaStream() constructor returns a newly-created , which serves as a collection of media tracks, each represented by a object.

remarks.para:
If any parameters are given, the specified tracks are added to the new stream.
Otherwise, the stream has no tracks.

MediaStreamMediaStream.returns:
A newly-created object, either empty, or containing the
tracks provided, if any.

MediaStreamGetTrackById.summary:
The getTrackById() method of the interface
returns a object representing the track with the specified ID
string. If there is no track with the specified ID, this method returns null.
MediaStreamGetTrackById.returns:
If a track is found for which matches the specified
id string, that object is returned.
Otherwise, the returned value is null.

MediaStreamAddtrack.summary: The addtrack event is fired when a new MediaStreamTrack object has been added to a MediaStream.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

-Related events: removetrack
-This event on AudioTrackList targets: addtrack
-This event on VideoTrackList targets: addtrack
-Media Capture and Streams API
-WebRTC

MediaStreamClone.summary:
The clone() method of the
interface creates a duplicate of the MediaStream. This new
MediaStream object has a new unique and
contains clones of every contained by the
MediaStream on which clone() was called.
MediaStreamClone.returns:
A new instance which has a new unique ID and contains clones
of every contained by the MediaStream on
which clone() was called.

MediaStreamRemovetrack.summary: The removetrack event is fired when a new object has been removed from a .

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

-Related events: addtrack
-This event on AudioTrackList targets: removetrack
-This event on VideoTrackList targets: removetrack
-Media Capture and Streams API
-WebRTC

MediaStreamRemoveTrack.summary:
The removeTrack() method of the interface removes a
from a stream.

MediaStreamGetAudioTracks.summary:
The getAudioTracks() method of the
interface returns a sequence that represents all the
objects in this
stream's track set where
is audio.
MediaStreamGetAudioTracks.returns:
An array of objects, one for each audio track contained
in the stream. Audio tracks are those tracks whose
property is audio. The array is empty if the stream contains no
audio tracks.
NOTEThe order of the returned tracks is not defined by the
specification and may, in fact, change from one call to getAudioTracks()
to the next.Early versions of this API included a special AudioStreamTrack interface
which was used as the type for each entry in the list of audio streams; however, this
has since been merged into the main interface.

MediaStreamId.summary:
The id read-only property of the interface is a
string containing 36 characters denoting a unique identifier (GUID)
for the object.

remarks.para: -, the interface this property belongs to.

MediaStreamActive.summary:
The active read-only property of the
interface returns a Boolean value which is
true if the stream is currently active; otherwise, it returns
false. A stream is considered active if at least one of
its s does not have its property
set to ended. Once every track has ended, the stream's active property becomes
false.
MediaStreamActive.value:
A Boolean value which is true if the stream is currently active;
otherwise, the value is false.
